info.description: REST API for interacting with the CBRAIN Platform
info.title: CBRAIN API

get.summary: Get session information
get.description: This returns information about the current session.

200.description: An object with the CBRAIN user ID

post.description:
This is the main entry point to create a CBRAIN session. Note that if
a user is currently logged in, a new session will not be available to
be created, and the current session will be re-used.

parameters.name: login
parameters.description: The username of the User trying to connect.

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: The CBRAIN User's password

200.description: An object with the session ID and the CBRAIN user ID

delete.description:
This destroys the current session, effectively terminating the API's
access to the service.

get.summary: Returns all of the users in CBRAIN.
get.description: Returns all of the users registered in CBRAIN, as well as information on their permissions and group/site memberships.

200.description: A list of all the users in CBRAIN.

post.summary: Create a new user in CBRAIN.
post.description: Creates a new user in CBRAIN.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: An object representing a new User and the autenticity token.

parameters.name: no_password_reset_needed
parameters.description: Do you want to force the user to reset their password upon first login

get.summary: Returns information about a user
get.description:
Returns the information about the user associated with the ID given in
argument. A normal user only has access to her own information, while an
administrator or site manager can have access to a larger set of users.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the user

200.description: An object with the CBRAIN user information

404.description: User not found with the specified ID

delete.description: Deletes a CBRAIN User from the database

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of user to update

401.description: Not authorized to delete this user.

404.description: User not found with the specified ID

patch.description: Updates the information about a user

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of user to update

parameters.name: force_password_reset
parameters.description: Boolean to force a password change

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: An object representing any parameter of the user that you would like to alter, only put ones that you would like to change.

200.description: An object with the CBRAIN user information

get.summary: Get a list of tool versions installed.
get.description: This method returns a list of tool config objects.

200.description:
An array of ToolConfig objects describing for each tool
and execution server the available version numbers and the
information about their local configuration.

get.summary: Get information about a particular tool configuration
get.description:
Returns the information about how a particular configuration of a
tool on an execution server.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: the ID of the configuration

200.description: A single ToolConfig object describing the configuration.

get.summary: Get a list of the tags currently in CBRAIN.
get.description: This method returns a list of tag objects.

200.description: An array of Tag objects that are used to group Tasks or Userfiles.

post.description: Create a new tag in CBRAIN.

parameters.name: tag[name]
parameters.description: The name of the Tag. No spaces or special chars allowed.

parameters.name: tag[group_id]
parameters.description: The Group that the Tag will be used in. All Users are part of Group 1

get.summary: Get one tag.
get.description: Returns a single tag with the ID specified.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the tag to get.

put.description: Update the tag specified by the ID parameter.

parameters.name: tag[name]
parameters.description: The new name for the Tag.

parameters.name: tag[group_id]
parameters.description: The Group that the Tag will be used in.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the tag to update.

delete.description: Delete the tag specified by the ID parameter.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the tag to delete.

get.summary: Get a list of the Bourreaux available to be used by the current user.
get.description: This method returns a list of Bourreau objects.

200.description:
An array of Bourreau objects describing an execution
server available to be used by the current user.

get.summary: Get information about a Bourreau.
get.description:
This method returns a single Bourreau object based on the
ID parameter.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the Bourreau to get information on.

200.description:
A Bourreau object with information about the status
of the execution server.

get.summary: Get a list of the Data Providers available to the current user.
get.description:
This method returns a list of Data Provider objects that represent
servers with disk space accessible for storing Userfiles.

200.description: An array of Data Provider objects describing servers that store data.

get.summary: Get information on a particular Data Provider.
get.description: This method returns a single Data Provider specified by the ID parameter

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the Data Provider to get information on.

get.summary: List the files on a Data Provider.
get.description:
This method allows the inspection of what files are present on a Data
Provider specified by the ID parameter. Files that are not yet registered
as Userfiles are visible using this method, as well as regularly accessible
Userfiles.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the Data Provider to browse.

200.description:
A list of files present in the Data Provider, with their associated
registration status, FileType, and other information.

post.summary: Registers a file as a Userfile in CBRAIN.
post.description:
This method allows new files to be added to CBRAIN. The files must first
be transfered to the Data Provider via SFTP. For more information on
SFTP file transfers, consult the CBRAIN Wiki documentation. Once files
are present on the Data Provider, this method registers them in CBRAIN
by specifying the file type. You can also specify to copy/move the files
to another Data Provider after file registration.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the Data Provider to register files on.

parameters.name: basenames[]
parameters.description: An array containing the filenames to register.

parameters.name: filetypes[]
parameters.description: An array containing the filetypes associated with the files to register

parameters.name: authenticity_token
parameters.description: The token returned by /session/new

403.description: The current user does not have access to register files.

post.summary: Unregisters files as Userfile in CBRAIN.
post.description:
This method allows files to be unregistered from CBRAIN. This will not
delete the files, but removes them from the CBRAIN database, so Tools
may no longer be run on them.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the Data Provider to unregister files from.

parameters.name: basenames[]
parameters.description: An array containing the filenames to unregister.

parameters.name: as_user_id
parameters.description: The ID of the user to unregister files as.

parameters.name: delete
parameters.description: Specifies to delete the files once they are unregistered.

parameters.name: authenticity_token
parameters.description: The token returned by /session/new

403.description: The current user does not have access to unregister files.

post.summary: Deletes unregistered files from a CBRAIN Data provider.
post.description:
This method allows files that have not been registered from CBRAIN to be
deleted. This may be necessary if files were uploaded in error, or if
they were unregistered but not immediately deleted.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the Data Provider to delete files from.

parameters.name: basenames[]
parameters.description: An array containing the filenames to delete.

parameters.name: as_user_id
parameters.description: The ID of the user to delete files as.

parameters.name: authenticity_token
parameters.description: The token returned by /session/new

200.description: Successfully launched the operation in the background to delete files.

403.description: You cannot delete files from this provider.

get.summary: Pings a Data Provider to check if it's running.
get.description:
This method allows the querying of a Data Provider specified by the ID
parameter to see if it's running or not.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the Data Provider to query.

get.summary: Get a list of the Groups (projects) available to the current user.
get.description:
This method returns a list of all of the groups that the current user has
access to.

post.description:
This method creates a new Group, which allows users to organize their files
and tasks.

parameters.name: group[name]
parameters.description: The name of the new Group.

parameters.name: group[description]
parameters.description: The description of the new Group.
parameters.default: This new Group represents a new, exciting, possibly neuroscience-related Project.

parameters.name: group[site_id]
parameters.description: The ID of the site associated with the Group.

parameters.name: group[invisible]
parameters.description: Specifies whether to make the group invisible or not. Invisible groups exist solely to control access to resources.

parameters.name: group[user_ids]
parameters.description: An array of IDs of Users that will be members of the new Group.

parameters.name: authenticity_token
parameters.description: The token returned by /session/new

post.description:
This method switches the active Group to a new one. This is useful if
the analysis that the user is performing is for different projects, and
involves separate Userfiles and Tasks.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID number of the Group to switch to

parameters.name: authenticity_token
parameters.description: The token returned by /session/new

get.summary: Get information on a Group (project).
get.description:
This method returns information on a single Group (project), specified
by the ID parameter. Information returned includes the list of Users
who are members of the group, the ID of the Site the Group is part of,
and whether or not the group is visible to Regular Users.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the Group to get information on.

200.description: Successfully retrieved information on the Group.

put.summary: Update the properties of a Group (project).
put.description:
This method allows the properties of a Group (project) to be updated.
This includes the User membership, the ID of the site the Group belongs
to, and the visibility status of the group to Regular Users.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the Group to be updated.

parameters.name: group[name]
parameters.description: The new name of the Group.

parameters.name: group[description]
parameters.description: The description of the new Group.
parameters.default: This project will group all of the files for a large neuroscience study to figure out how the brain works once and for all.

parameters.name: group[site_id]
parameters.description: The ID of the site associated with the Group.

parameters.name: group[invisible]
parameters.description: Specifies whether to make the group invisible or not. Invisible groups exist solely to control access to resources.

parameters.name: group[user_ids]
parameters.description: An array of IDs of Users that will be members of the new Group.

403.description: Current user is forbidden from editing this group.

delete.description:
This method allows the removal of Groups (projects) that are no longer
necessary. Groups that have Userfiles associated with them may not be
deleted.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the Group to delete.

parameters.name: authenticity_token
parameters.description: The token returned by /session/new

get.summary: List of the Userfiles accessible to the current user.
get.description:
This method returns a list of Userfiles that are available to the current
User.

post.description:
This method creates a new Userfile in CBRAIN, with the current user
as the owner of the file.

parameters.name: upload_file
parameters.description: File to upload to CBRAIN

parameters.name: data_provider_id
parameters.description: The ID of the Data Provider to upload the file to.

parameters.name: userfile[group_id]
parameters.description: ID of the group that will have access to the Userfile

parameters.name: file_type
parameters.description: The type of the file

parameters.name: archive
parameters.description: Archive

parameters.name: authenticity_token
parameters.description: The token returned by /session/new

parameters.name: _up_ex_mode
parameters.description: usually "collection"

get.summary: Get information on a Userfile.
get.description:
This method returns information about a single Userfile, specified by
its ID. Information returned includes the ID of the owner, the Group
(project) it is a part of, a description, information about where the
acutal copy of the file currently is, and what the status is of any
synhronization operations that may have been requested.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID number of the Userfile to get information on.

200.description: Returns the information about the Userfile.

put.description: This method allows a User to update information on a userfile.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID number of the Userfile to update.

parameters.name: userfile[type]
parameters.description: Type of file that the Userfile is registered in CBRAIN as. This parameter affects what kinds of Tools can be used on the file.

parameters.name: userfile[user_id]
parameters.description: ID of the user who owns the file.

parameters.name: userfile[group_id]
parameters.description: ID of the group that will have access to the Userfile.

parameters.name: tag_ids[]
parameters.description: ID numbers of the tags that describe the Userfile.

parameters.name: userfile[group_writable]
parameters.description: Specifies whether other members of the group that owns the file can modify the Userfile.

parameters.name: userfile[hidden]
parameters.description: Specifies whether the Userfile is hidden or visible in the normal file listing.

parameters.name: userfile[immutable]
parameters.description: Specifies whether the Userfile can be modified.

parameters.name: userfile[description]
parameters.description: Description of the Userfile.

parameters.name: authenticity_token
parameters.description: The token returned by /session/new

delete.description: This method allows a User to delete a Userfile.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID number of the Userfile to delete.

parameters.name: authenticity_token
parameters.description: The token returned by /session/new

get.summary: Get the content of a Userfile
get.description: This method allows you to download Userfiles.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID number of the Userfile to download

post.description: This method compresses several Userfiles in .gz format and prepares them to be downloaded.

parameters.name: file_ids[]
parameters.description: The ID numbers of the files to be downloaded. If more than one file is specified, they will be zipped into a gzip archive.

parameters.name: specified_filename
parameters.description: The name of the archive file that the Userfiles will be compressed into for downloading.

parameters.name: authenticity_token
parameters.description: The token returned by /session/new

200.description: Indicates that the files are being compressed and downloaded.

post.summary: Delete several files that have been registered as Userfiles

parameters.name: file_ids[]
parameters.description: The ID numbers of the files to be deleted

parameters.name: authenticity_token
parameters.description: The token returned by /session/new

200.description: Indicates that the files are being deleted.

post.summary: Moves the Userfiles from their current Data Provider to a new one.

parameters.name: file_ids[]
parameters.description: The ID's of the Userfiles to be moved or copied to a new Data Provider.

parameters.name: data_provider_id_for_mv_cp
parameters.description: The ID of the Data Provider to move or copy the files to.

parameters.name: crush_destination
parameters.description: Specifies whether to overwrite files on the destination Data Provider if a file already exists there with the same name

parameters.name: authenticity_token
parameters.description: The token returned by /session/new

200.description: Indicates that the files are being moved or copied in the background.

post.summary: Compresses many Userfiles each into their own GZIP archive.

parameters.name: file_ids[]
parameters.description: A list of Userfile ID numbers to compress.

parameters.name: authenticity_token
parameters.description: The token returned by /session/new

200.description: Indicates that the compression is starting in the background.

parameters.name: file_ids[]
parameters.description: A list of Userfile ID numbers to uncompress.

parameters.name: authenticity_token
parameters.description: The token returned by /session/new

200.description: Indicates that files are being uncompressed in the background.

post.summary: Syncs Userfiles to their Data Providers' cache.
post.description: Synchronizing files to their Data Providers' caches allows you to download, visualize and do processing on them that is not available if not synced. CBRAIN operations will sync files automatically, and this is only necessary if a file is changed on its host Data Provdier by an external process.

parameters.name: file_ids[]
parameters.description: A list of Userfile ID numbers to synchronize.

parameters.name: operation
parameters.description: Either "sync_local" or "all_newer". "sync_local" will ensure that the version of the file in the CBRAIN portal cache is the most recent version that exists on the Data Provider. "all_newer" will ensure that ALL caches known to CBRAIN are updated with the most recent version of the files in the host Data Provider.

parameters.name: authenticity_token
parameters.description: The token returned by /session/new

200.description: Indicates that synchronization is starting in the background

get.summary: Get the list of Tasks.
get.description: This method returns the list of Tasks accessible to the current user.

post.description: This method allows the creation of a new Task.

parameters.name: cbrain_task
parameters.description: The task to create.

get.summary: Get information on a Task.
get.description:
This method returns information on a Task, including its status,
Task restartability and information on where the results are kept.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID number of the Task to delete.

put.description: This method updates information about a Task in CBRAIN.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID number of the Task to update.

parameters.name: cbrain_task[results_data_provider_id]
parameters.description: ID of the DataProvider to store the results of the Task on.

parameters.name: cbrain_task[description]
parameters.description: Description of the Task.

parameters.name: cbrain_task[user_id]
parameters.description: ID of the User the Task should be associated with.

parameters.name: cbrain_task[group_id]
parameters.description: ID of the Group the Task should be associated with.

parameters.name: authenticity_token
parameters.description: The token returned by /session/new

parameters.name: authenticity_token
parameters.description: The token returned by /session/new

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID number of the Task to delete.

200.description: Indicates that the Task is being deleted in the background.

get.summary: Get the list of Tools.
get.description:
This method returns a list of all of the Tools that exist in CBRAIN.
Tools encapsulate a scientific program designed to extract information
from an input Userfile.

id.description: Unique numerical ID for the user.

city.description: city where the user is located

country.description: country where the user is located

time_zone.description: time-zone (should make it this an enum)

site_id.description: ID of the site affiliation for the user. If this is not specified, the user will go into the default Site

last_connected_at.description: time of last connection by the user. (can be empty)

account_locked.description: Whether or not the account is locked.

id.description: Unique numerical ID for the ToolConfig.

version_name.description: the version name of the tool's configuration

tool_id.description: the ID of the tool associated with this configuration

bourreau_id.description:
The ID of the execution server where this tool
configuration is available.

script_prologue.description:
A piece of bash script configured by the administrator to
run before the tool is launched.

group_id.description: the ID of the project controlling access to this ToolConfig

ncpus.description:
A hint at how many CPUs the CBRAIN task will allocate
to run this tool configuration

name.description: Name of the tag. This holds all the information about what the tag is supposed to indicate about your files.

user_id.description: The ID of the user that the tag belongs to.

group_id.description: The ID of the group that the tag belongs to.

id.description: Unique numerical ID for the bourreau.

name.description: Name given by the creator to the bourreau.

user_id.description: ID of the creator of the bourreau.

group_id.description: ID of the group allowed to use the bourreau.

read_only.description: Specifies whether the bourreau is read-only or can be modified.

id.description: Unique ID for the Data Provider.

type.description: Type of Data Provider, which usually indicates whether it is a local Data Provider, has a flat internal directory structure, or is meant for file uploading to CBRAIN.

user_id.description: Creator and owner of the Data Provider.

group_id.description: ID of the group that has access to this Data Provider.

online.description: Boolean variable that indicates whether the system hosting the Data Provider is accessible.

read_only.description: Boolean variable that indicates whether the Data Provider can be written to.

time_of_death.description: The time, in the time zone of the system that hosts the Data Provider, that the Data Provider last successfully transmitted.

not_syncable.description: Boolean variable that indicates that the data residing on the Data Provider is not available to be transferred to an execution server's cache.

time_zone.description: Time zone of the system that hosts the Data Provider.

site_id.description: ID of the site associated with the group.

creator_id.description: ID of the User who created the group.

invisible.description:
Specifies whether or not the group is visible to Normal Users.
Invisible groups exist to specify levels of access to Userfiles,
DataProviders and Bourreaux.

name.description: Name of the file that the Userfile represents

size.description: Number of bytes used to store the file.

user_id.description: ID of the owner of the file.

parent_id.description: ID of the parent Userfile, if any exists, or null otherwise.

type.description: Type of the file. This is important in determining what tools can be run on the file. The most generic file types, are the Single File, which represents one file, and the File Collection, which represents a directory full of files.

group_id.description: ID of the group that owns the file, which determines its visibility status.

data_provider_id.description: ID of the Data Provider that is hosting the persistent copy of the file. It may exist in caches across the systems that make up CBRAIN, as copies of the file are made in order to run scientific programs on them on remote systems.

group_writable.description: Boolean variable that specifies whether members of the owner group have access to modify or overwrite the file.

num_files.description: Number of files that the Userfiles represents. For Single Files, this is always 1.

hidden.description: Boolean variable that specifies whether this file is hidden or not in the user interface.

immutable.description: Boolean variable that specifies whether any user can modify the contents of the file.

archived.description: Boolean variable that specifies whether the file is available, uncompressed, or has been archived.

batch_id.description: ID of the batch this task was launched as part of. Batches of tasks consist of the same task, with the same parameters, being run on many different input files.

cluster_jobid.description: ID of the task on the cluster associated with this task.

cluster_workdir.description: Path on the cluster to the working directory.

params.description: Parameters used as inputs to the scientific calculation associated with the task.

user_id.description: ID of the User who created the Task.

bourreau_id.description: ID of the Bourreau the Task was launched on.

run_number.description: The number of attempts that it has taken to run the task.

group_id.description: ID of the group that this task is being run in.

tool_config_id.description: ID number that specifies which Tool Config to use. The Tool Config specifies environment variables and other system-specific scripts necessary for the Task to be run in the target environment.

results_data_provider_id.description: ID of the Data Provider that contains the Userfile that represents the results of the task.

workdir_archived.description: Boolean variable that indicates whether the working directory of the task is available on the processing server or has been archived and is no longer accessible.

workdir_archive_userfile_id.description: ID of the userfile created as part of the archival process, if the task's working directory has been archived.

group_id.description: Group that has access to the Tool.

cbrain_task_class_name.description: The name of the Task class that will be created when jobs are launched using the Tool.

select_menu_text.description: Text that appears for Tool selection.

url.description: URL of the website that describes the Tool and possibly has code for the Tool.

group.description: string representation of gid, the group's name

gid.description: numeric group id of the file

owner.description: string representation of uid, the owner's name

permissions.description: an int interpreted in octal, e.g. 0640

state_ok.description: flag that tell whether or not it's OK to register/unregister

message.description: a message to give more information about the state_ok flag
